title: Maintaining Acceptable Water Pressure in Showerheads

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs the repeal of a detailed federal regulation that defines the term "showerhead" and its related standards, arguing that such regulation overcomplicates a simple household item and restricts personal freedom. The order mandates the Secretary of Energy to formally rescind this regulation to reduce government overreach.
potential_concerns: Repealing detailed showerhead standards may reduce water efficiency, increasing utility costs for low-income individuals and working-age adults dependent on affordable water bills.
Environmental justice communities in urban and rural areas could face disproportionate negative impacts due to higher water usage and reduced conservation resulting from deregulation.
Consumers may experience inconsistent water pressure quality as manufacturers no longer adhere to standardized federal definitions, leading to variable product performance.
The removal of federal standards could hinder state and local governments' ability to enforce water conservation policies, exacerbating regional water shortages affecting vulnerable communities.
